name: crane
content:
crane noun [C]
(MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tall metal structure with a long horizontal part, used for lifting and moving heavy objects: The crane lifted the container off the ship.
Gearstd/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

crane noun [C]
(BIRD)
a tall bird with long, thin legs and a long neck
mari_art/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

to stretch in order to look at something: He craned forward to see the procession. Mike was craning his neck to get the first glimpse of the car.

crane noun [C]
(MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large machine with a long, movable part to which is fixed cables (= strong wires) for lifting and moving heavy objects
crane noun [C]
(BIRD)
a large water bird with long, thin legs and a long neck
crane verb [I/T]
(STRETCH)
to stretch in order to look at something: [ I/T ] We were all craning (our necks) to get a glimpse of the movie star.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tall metal structure with a long horizontal part that is used for lifting and moving heavy objects: We are one of the top crane hire companies in the country. At the time he was working as a crane operator.
